body_html:
any model. base on this link:

https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/tutorials/image_recognition/ it is for V3 only.

You can only predict an image base .pb file, This .pb file is from .ckpt and .pbtxt, by freeze graph right? If we only have pre-trained model .ckpt file, we can do nothing.

Furthermore, we can only get tensor name from .pb file, but not .ckpt file. Why there are so many different formats and there is no easy way to convert?

https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/tutorials/image_recognition/   it is for V3 only.
You can only predict an image base .pb file, This .pb file is from .ckpt and .pbtxt, by freeze graph right? If we only have pre-trained model .ckpt file, we can do nothing.
Furthermore, we can only get tensor name from .pb file, but not .ckpt file. Why there are so many different formats and there is no easy way to convert?
body:
any model. base on this link:

https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/tutorials/image_recognition/   it is for V3 only.

You can only predict an image base .pb file, This .pb file is from .ckpt and .pbtxt, by freeze graph right? If we only have pre-trained model .ckpt file, we can do nothing.

Furthermore, we can only get tensor name from .pb file, but not .ckpt file. Why there are so many different formats and there is no easy way to convert?
